items.title: Would you consider a PR for binary wheels?
items.body:
With a binary wheel one could eliminate the need to separately install libexempi3. This would simplify installation of python-xmp-toolkit down to simply `pip install python-xmp-toolkit`.

I'd be happy to do the work in a PR, which I've for several projects now. 

At the same time I'd update the version matrix to drop end of life versions and add the latest in the 3.x series.

However, since this project has been inactive for some time, I would appreciate if a contributor can confirm that they would be willing to consider such changes.

items.title: get_property leading to ambiguous Exempi failure
items.body:
Hi, I'm calling get_property() on a child node in the xmp of a tiff file. The namespace is RDF, and the actual node name is 'li', <rdf:li xml:lang="x-default"> . 

Exempi fails with an ambiguous message. Any insight? 

(also on a side note, what's the best way to edit the meta info of individual tiff pages? Make them individually then merge them together?) 

`Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/lihan/Documents/image/src/preprocessing2.py", line 32, in <module>
    write_header()
  File "/home/lihan/Documents/image/src/preprocessing2.py", line 26, in write_header
    print(xmp.get_property(consts.XMP_NS_RDF, 'li') )
  File "/home/lihan/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/libxmp/core.py", line 195, in get_property
    value, _ = _cexempi.get_property(self.xmpptr, schema_ns, prop_name)
  File "/home/lihan/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/libxmp/exempi.py", line 670, in get_property
    _value, ctypes.byref(prop_bits))
  File "/home/lihan/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/libxmp/exempi.py", line 1702, in check_error
    raise XMPError(msg)
libxmp.XMPError: Exempi function failure ("unknown error").`

Hi,
we've got a test failure here in the Debian package:
```
======================================================================

Get just leaf names from a single path, single namespace.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/<<BUILDDIR>>/python-xmp-toolkit-2.0.1+git20140309.5437b0a/test/test_exempi.py", line 546, in test_single_namespace_single_path_leaf_names
    self.assertEqual(schemas, [NS_DC, NS_DC, NS_DC])
AssertionError: Lists differ: [u'http://purl.org/dc/elements... != ['http://purl.org/dc/elements/...

First differing element 1:
u''
'http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/'

- [u'http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/',
?  -

+ ['http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/',
-  u'',
-  u'http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace']
+  'http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/',
+  'http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/']

----------------------------------------------------------------------

FAILED (failures=1, skipped=3)
```
Buildlog: <http://aws-logs.debian.net/2017/01/11/python-xmp-toolkit_2.0.1+git20140309.5437b0a-3_unstable.log>
DS

Could I use this library to insert Google Photo Sphere XMP into an image?

https://developers.google.com/streetview/spherical-metadata#example_of_a_full_photo_sphere

items.title: Can't update xmp in an xmp file
items.body:
An xmp sidecar is a text file containing only xmp data.

Attempting to update such a file returns, 

```
 90     xmpfile = XMPFiles(file_path=xmp_file_name, open_forupdate=True)
 91     xmp = xmpfile.get_xmp()  # load metadata as python dict of arrays
```

---> 92     if xmpfile.can_put_xmp(xmp):
     93         try:
     94             if stars > -1:

/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/libxmp/files.pyc in can_put_xmp(self, xmp_obj)
    165         """
    166         if not isinstance( xmp_obj, XMPMeta ):
--> 167             raise XMPError('Not a XMPMeta object')
    168 
    169         xmpptr = xmp_obj.xmpptr

XMPError: Not a XMPMeta object

Oh, well.

items.title: Reference section of documentation contains headings but no content
items.body: Something must have happened when it was created.

items.title: Feature Request: GUI/Nautilus scripts etc
items.body:
Hey,

forgive me if I'm wrong here - I'm an end-user that desperately tries to find a friendly way to edit XMP Data.

I'm searching for a way to easily add/edit/remove keywords in certain files but I'm command-line challenged. A GUI is perhaps too much to ask for but maybe someone could create some simple scripts for file-managers (such as nautilus etc.) that allow such tasks on selected files/folders?

cheers

items.title: Add support for exempi 2.3.0 function xmp_files_get_xmp_xmpstring
Qualify on exempi 2.3.0
items.body: Exempi 2.3.0 has been released, make sure we can work with it.

items.title: get_property_datetime() returns wrong UTC
items.body:
Hi,
I think there's a mistake in get_property_datetime() with the conversion to UTC:

```
print xmp.get_property(consts.XMP_NS_XMP, 'ModifyDate')
2012-03-21T08:57:17-07:00
print xmp.get_property_datetime(consts.XMP_NS_XMP, 'ModifyDate')
2012-03-21 01:57:17+00:00
```

but UTC of 08:57-07:00 (seven hours behind UTC) is 15:57+00:00. Patch:

```
--- a/libxmp/exempi.py
+++ b/libxmp/exempi.py
@@ -769,7 +769,7 @@
                                minutes=xmp_date_time.tzminute,
                                microseconds=xmp_date_time.nanosecond * 1000)

-    if xmp_date_time.tzsign < 0:
+    if xmp_date_time.tzsign > 0:
         the_date = utc_date - delta
     else:
         the_date = utc_date + delta
```

Best,
DS

items.title: Not saving updated files?
items.body:
Hi.  I'm trying to use your toolkit, but I can't get it to update the files, even after calling xmpfile.close().

I wrote a sample test which uses your BlueSquare sample files:

```
import libxmp
import libxmp.utils
from libxmp import XMPFiles, consts
from libxmp.utils import file_to_dict,object_to_dict

def print_obj(xmp):
    print 'PRINTING OBJECT'
    xmp_dict    = object_to_dict(xmp)
    dc          = xmp_dict[consts.XMP_NS_DC]
    for xx in dc:
        print xx[0],xx[1]

def print_file(fname):
    print 'PRINTING {}'.format(fname)
    xmp_dict    = file_to_dict(fname)
    dc          = xmp_dict[consts.XMP_NS_DC]
    for xx in dc:
        print xx[0],xx[1]

fnames  = ['BlueSquare.pdf','BlueSquare.png']

for fname in fnames:
    xmpfile = XMPFiles(file_path=fname,open_forupdate=True)
    xmp     = xmpfile.get_xmp()
    if xmp is None:
        xmp = libxmp.XMPMeta()

    xmp.set_property(consts.XMP_NS_DC,u'test_property',u'test_val')
    res = xmpfile.can_put_xmp(xmp)
    xmpfile.close_file()

    print_obj(xmp)
    print ''
    print_file(fname)
```

For both the PNG and PDF files, I can to the metadata, but cannot save to disk.  This is the result from print_obj() and print_file() above (PNG result, but PDF is essentially the same):

```
PRINTING OBJECT
dc:format application/vnd.adobe.photoshop
dc:title
dc:title[1] Blue Square Test File - .psd
dc:title[1]/?xml:lang x-default
dc:description
dc:description[1] XMPFiles BlueSquare test file, created in Photoshop CS2, saved as .psd, .jpg, and .tif.
dc:description[1]/?xml:lang x-default
dc:subject
dc:subject[1] XMP
dc:subject[2] Blue Square
dc:subject[3] test file
dc:subject[4] Photoshop
dc:subject[5] .psd
dc:test_property test_val

PRINTING BlueSquare.png
dc:format application/vnd.adobe.photoshop
dc:title
dc:title[1] Blue Square Test File - .psd
dc:title[1]/?xml:lang x-default
dc:description
dc:description[1] XMPFiles BlueSquare test file, created in Photoshop CS2, saved as .psd, .jpg, and .tif.
dc:description[1]/?xml:lang x-default
dc:subject
dc:subject[1] XMP
dc:subject[2] Blue Square
dc:subject[3] test file
dc:subject[4] Photoshop
dc:subject[5] .psd
```

Thanks for any help you can give,
Nathaniel

items.title: consts.XMP_PROP_OPTIONS does not match object_to_dict output
items.body: After doing a conversion like object_to_dict or file_to_dict the complete list of options is: array_is_alt array_is_alttext array_is_ordered has_aliases has_lang has_qualifiers has_type is_alias is_derived is_internal is_qualifier is_schema is_stable value_is_array value_is_struct value_is_uri The complete list of XMP_PROP_OPTIONS appears to be this: prop_array_is_alt prop_array_is_alttext prop_array_is_ordered prop_array_is_unordered prop_has_aliases prop_has_lang prop_has_qualifiers prop_has_type prop_is_alias prop_is_deriver prop_is_internal prop_is_qualifier prop_is_schema prop_is_stable prop_value_is_array prop_value_is_struct prop_value_is_uri It seems like "is_deriver" must be a typo, and I'm not sure if the prop_array_is_unordered is legitimate or not. Maybe it has been omitted from the __to_dict operations, but it seems strange to have a property for *both_ is_ordered and is_unordered...

items.title: Custom Schema
items.body:
Is there an easy way to add custom schema to XMP through the python-xmp-toolkit (or the underlying exempi)?

I'm looking to do something similar to the Adobe's custom schema example application but would love to be able to do it in python-xmp instead of writing cpp code. 
https://github.com/hfiguiere/exempi/blob/master/samples/source/CustomSchema.cpp

Are there any tooling out there to embed custom namespaced xml into xmp?

Thanks!

items.title: UnicodeDecodeError when opening unicode filenames
items.body:
The `XMPFiles` class seems to handle unicode strings incorrectly and raises `UnicodeDecodeError` if I try to open a path with characters outside of the ASCII range.

Example :

``` python
>>> XMPFiles(file_path=u"éà*çc! teeest!!/image.tif")
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position 0-1: ordinal not in range(128)
```

items.title: file_to_dict() import is broken
items.body:
Hello,

As specified in documentation (http://python-xmp-toolkit.readthedocs.org/en/latest/using.html#method-1-read-xmp)

`from libxmp import *`
`xmp = file_to_dict( "/path/to/some/file_with_xmp.ext" )`

file_to_dict is not imported anymore with the joker, 
`from libxmp.utils import file_to_dict` is necessary instead.

Maybe it should be fix in `__all__` or in the doc.

Thanks.

items.title: Segfault when iterator_new method called with schema as None
items.body:
Differs from issue27 in that property is not None here, but it still may be the same case.

The test is test_no_namespace_single_prop_leaf_nodes.  The idea seems to be as to whether we can collect all leaf nodes for all schemas for a single property.  Does that even make sense?

items.title: Investigate xmp_files_check_file_format with PDF, ILLUSTRATOR
items.body: test_format_pdf and test_format_illustrator are skipped because the library function xmp_files_check_file_format function seems to fail on those two formats.  Needs better explanation/documentations than what currently exists.

items.title: Deleting a property from an invalid schema should trigger an exception.
items.body:
The test.test_core_unit.NegativeTestCases.test_delete_property_bad_schma was written to verify that trying to delete a property from a non-existing schema would trigger an exception.  That was not happening, so the test was beings skipped.  

The issue seems to have resolved when #21 was fixed.  The test can be re-enabled.

items.title: Reassess quicktime with usesmarthandler and limitscanning options
items.body: test.test_files.XMPFilesTestCase.test_exempi_bad_combinations suggests that MOV with 'open_usesmarthandler' and 'open_limitscanning' options on snow leopard cannot work.  But it seems ok.

items.title: Rework test.test_files.XMPFilesTestCase.test_write_in_read_only
items.body:
The test is written in a way that is misleading as to what it actually is supposed to accomplish.  It's supposed to verify that we cannot write xmp back to a file that's not opened for update.  

The test mixes that up with writing text that might be problematic because of its length.

items.title: test_tiff_leak segfaults with homebrew
items.body: Basically the same as issue 18, but macports is on version 2.2.1 while homebrew is currently on 2.2.0.  These two package managers have radically different patches for their respective versions.

items.title: test.test_core_unit.XMPMetaTestCase.test_serialize_unicode fails on homebrew
items.body:
Homebrew fails to raise the appropriate exception when `read_only_packet` is true and `omit_packet_wrapper` is true.  

Homebrew uses 2.2.0 instead of 2.2.1, but this may not be the issue, as linux works just fine with 2.2.0.

items.title: Remove flufl.enum dependency
items.body:
This seemed like a good idea and it would dovetail nicely with python 3.4, but it's not really needed at the moment and it duplicates work that has already been done in 1.0.2.

`flufl.enum` is also currently difficult to install on macports due to current state of setuptools/distribute.

items.title: Can't install python-xmp-toolkit on mac, python3.3
items.body: flufl.enum requirement can't currently be installed, problem with setuptools/distribute

items.title: test_tiff_leak segfaults on mac os X
items.body: Setup is not with macports exempi but source-compiled 2.1.1

items.title: Restore windll call
items.body: Unknown if exempi can work on windows, but we should at least allow for the possibility.   The call used to exist in 1.0.2

items.title: __repr__ must return byte strings in 2.7, not unicode
items.body: Therefore the XMPMeta `__repr__`  currently in devel branch is wrong.

items.title: Minimum exempi version is 2.2.0
items.body: The documentation states that 2.1.1 is the minimum installed version, but many tests fail with that version. 2.2.0 appears to be the minimum. In particular, test.test_core_unit.XMPMetaTestCase.test_count_array_items goes into an infinite loop. It seems that this happens because the exempi library routine xmp_get_array_item does not return False upon failure?

items.title: Nested Arrays
items.body: This was issue 17 in the old google-code site. What steps will reproduce the problem? ``` from libxmp import XMPMeta from libxmp.consts import XMP_NS_DM as NS_DM from libxmp.consts import XMP_PROP_VALUE_IS_ARRAY, XMP_PROP_ARRAY_IS_UNORDERED from libxmp.consts import XMP_PROP_ARRAY_IS_ORDERED x = XMPMeta() x.set_property(NS_DM, 'tracks','', prop_value_is_array=XMP_PROP_VALUE_IS_ARRAY, prop_array_is_unordered=XMP_PROP_ARRAY_IS_UNORDERED) array_options={'prop_value_is_array':XMP_PROP_VALUE_IS_ARRAY, 'prop_array_is_ordered':XMP_PROP_ARRAY_IS_ORDERED } x.set_array_item(NS_DM, 'tracks', 1, 'markers', array_options=array_options) print(x) ``` What is the expected output? What do you see instead? ``` ``` but I see ``` markers ```

items.title: Text property limited to 255 chars?
items.body: This was issue 7 on the old google-code site. Reported by clr.port...@gmail.com, May 8, 2009 What steps will reproduce the problem? ``` xmp = XMPFiles( file_path="/home/clr/ruby/rails/spitzer.caltech.edu/spec/fixtures/test.tif" ) xmp_data = xmp.get_xmp() xmp_data.get_property( "http://ns.adobe.com/photoshop/1.0/", 'Headline' ) ``` What is the expected output? What do you see instead? expected: A string around 450 characters long. got: A string 255 characters long. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? python-xmp-toolkit-rc1.0 Fedora GNU/Linux

items.title: "make runtests" broken
items.body:
This was issue 18 in the old google-code site.

Reported by jwilk@jwilk.net, Jan 27, 2012
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Run "make runtests".

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

According to the documentation, this should run the testsuite, but it doesn't quite work:

```
$ make runtests
env PYTHONPATH=.:YTHONPATH python test/test_all.py
test_can_put_xmp (test_files.XMPFilesTestCase) ... ERROR
test_close_file (test_files.XMPFilesTestCase) ... ERROR
.
.
.
```

items.title: Cannot inject XMP into PDF with no existing XMP packet
items.body:
This was issue 20 on the old google code site

Reported by cfarrell...@gmail.com, Apr 24, 2012
I want to _add_ xmp to an existing PDF file which doesn't have xmp data yet. I tried opening the existing file:

> > > from libxmp import *
> > > xmpfile = XMPFiles( file_path="1.pdf")
> > > xmp = xmpfile.get_xmp()
> > > print type(xmp)
> > > <type 'NoneType'>

I read on http://forums.adobe.com/thread/708717 that it does not seem to be possible to inject xmp data into an already existing PDF from their toolkit.

Thus, do I have to use something like acrobat to create the PDF first or is it in some way possible for python-xmp-toolkit to inject xmp?

items.title: Adding own property deletes (all) others
items.body:
This was issue 21 on the old google code site.  Basically the issue claimed was that if one registered one's own namespace and sets a property, other properties may be deleted.  In the original reproduction steps, the XMP tags vanished.  This does not now seem to be reproducible.

```
f=libxmp.XMPFiles()
x=libxmp.XMPMeta()
f.open_file('BlueSquare.jpg', open_forupdate=True)
x = f.get_xmp()
print(x)
```

items.title: Cannot load libexmpi on macports
items.body:
```
In [12]: x = ctypes.CDLL('/opt/local/lib/libexempi.dylib')
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
OSError                                   Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-12-4661d7b87bd5> in <module>()
----> 1 x = ctypes.CDLL('/opt/local/lib/libexempi.dylib')

/opt/local/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.3/lib/python3.3/ctypes/__init__.py in __init__(self, name, mode, handle, use_errno, use_last_error)
    351 
    352         if handle is None:
--> 353             self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode)
    354         else:
    355             self._handle = handle

OSError: dlopen(/opt/local/lib/libexempi.dylib, 6): Symbol not found: __Z16ConvertToMacLangRKSstPSs
  Referenced from: /opt/local/lib/libexempi.dylib
  Expected in: flat namespace
 in /opt/local/lib/libexempi.dylib
```

items.title: Additional file open failures
items.body:
`XMPMeta.open_file` can silently fail.  The `BlueSquare.pdf` test sample file cannot be opened with the `open_usesmarthandler` option, which can be show by stepping through the code 

```
 filename = pkg_resources.resource_filename(__name__,                    
                                                   "samples/BlueSquare.pdf")    
 xmpfile = XMPFiles()                                                    
 with self.assertRaises(XMPError):                                       
     xmpfile.open_file(filename, open_usesmarthandler=True)  
```

The old code returns false from the ctypes open_file call, but the _check_error function ignores the error code of zero, which is still an error.

items.title: XMPMeta skip method cannot work?
items.body: Was missing "self" argument.  How does this get called anyway.

items.title: XMPMeta method "does_array_item_exist" is broken.
items.body: If an array item does not exist, the implementation exits with the index set to the last element in the list, which evaluates to True if there is more than one item.

items.title: Push ctypes functionality into single module
items.body: If the ctypes interface is localized into a single module, all the string handling/encoding/decoding might be localized there as well, which may simplify the code a bit.
